page.title: 01North Green & Linstead Magna
page.content: Largely flat, this area is placed on the watershed between river Waveney to northwest and River Blyth to the east. Intense cultivation has led, in the main, to the removal of many trees and hedges which accentuates the flatness of the land. However, a small deciduous wood is to the east. A radio mast and water tower in the north east are the most noticeable landmarks. The area is situated between four villages, Metfield,fressing field and Cratfield are to the north, west and south respectively and the hamlet of Linstead is to the east. The population is scattered throughout the whole area and most of the dwellings are eiter farmhoues or the homes of farmworkers. The land is intensive arable with some pasture for dairy cattle. On Metfield common large buildings house
